item.title: 上汽大众称调整工厂基地 "有必要"
item.description: 据中国媒体《一财》报道，上汽大众周六回应将关闭南京工厂的报道称，调整生产基地是 "正常且必要的"。【原文：SAIC Volkswagen, responding to reports it would close its Nanjing plant, said on Saturday that adjusting its production base was "normal and necessary", Chinese media outlet Yicai reported.】

item.title: X 指定巴西法律代表，其律师称
item.description: 埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）拥有的社交媒体平台 X 已任命了一名驻巴西的法律代表，该公司的律师周五表示，此举将满足巴西最高法院提出的允许该公司在巴西运营的要求之一。【原文：Elon Musk-owned social media platform X has named a legal representative in Brazil, the firm's lawyers said on Friday, in a move that would address one of the demands imposed by Brazil's top court to allow the company to operate in the country.】

item.title: 美国联邦贸易委员会主席莉娜-汗欢迎企业在交易中权衡反垄断，并向批评者发表讲话
item.description: 美国联邦贸易委员会主席莉娜-汗（Lina Khan）周五对企业在交易过程中尽早权衡反垄断因素表示欢迎。【原文：U.S. Federal Trade Commission Chair Lina Khan on Friday welcomed that companies are weighing antitrust considerations early in their dealmaking process.】

item.title: 美国证券交易委员会批准现货比特币 ETF 选项
item.description: 美国证券交易委员会批准了资产管理公司贝莱德的现货比特币交易所交易基金的期权。【原文：The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission has approved options to asset manager BlackRock's spot bitcoin exchange-traded fund.】

item.title: 波音防务主管泰德-科尔伯特离职
item.description: 波音公司周五表示，其国防、太空和安全部总裁兼首席执行官泰德-科尔伯特（Ted Colbert）将从即日起离职。【原文：Boeing said on Friday that Ted Colbert, president and CEO of its defense, space and security unit will be leaving the company effective immediately.】

item.title: 秘鲁中央银行预测，秘鲁回升的经济今年将增长 3.1
item.description: 秘鲁央行周五在一份报告中称，预计这个安第斯国家的经济今年将增长3.1%，2025年将再增长3.0%，维持了在去年国内生产总值（GDP）萎缩0.6%之后出现反弹的预期。【原文：Peru's central bank expects that the Andean nation's economy will grow 3.1% this year and a further 3.0% in 2025, it said in a report on Friday, maintaining expectations for a rebound after gross domestic product (GDP) contracted by 0.6% last year.】

item.title: 美国证券交易委员会拟在推特调查中寻求对埃隆-马斯克的制裁
item.description: 美国证券交易委员会（U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission）周五表示，拟对埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）实施制裁，因为他未能按计划出席监管机构对其斥资 440 亿美元收购推特（Twitter）的调查作证。【原文：The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission said on Friday it intends to seek sanctions against Elon Musk after he failed to appear for scheduled testimony for the regulator's probe into his $44 billion takeover of Twitter.】

item.title: J&J子公司申请破产以推进80亿美元的滑石粉和解协议
item.description: 强生（Johnson & Johnson）的一家子公司周五第三次申请破产，因为这家医疗保健巨头正寻求推进一项约 80 亿美元的拟议解决方案，以结束数万起指控该公司婴儿爽身粉和其他滑石粉产品致癌的诉讼。【原文：A Johnson & Johnson subsidiary filed for bankruptcy for a third time on Friday as the healthcare giant seeks to advance an approximately $8 billion proposed settlement that would end tens of thousands of lawsuits alleging that the company's baby powder and other talc products caused cancer.】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，高通公司近日与英特尔公司就收购事宜进行了接触
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周五援引知情人士的话报道，高通公司近日向芯片制造商英特尔公司提出了收购意向。【原文：Qualcomm made a takeover approach to chipmaker Intel in recent days, the Wall Street Journal reported on Friday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 华尔街一周前瞻 美联储减息后，投资者焦点转向数据、大选和盈利
item.description: 在未来几周里，投资者将面临经济数据、迫在眉睫的政治不确定性和企业盈利的考验，美股的飙升将成为今年股市最动荡的时期之一。【原文：A roaring rally in U.S. stocks will face a gauntlet of economic data, looming political uncertainty and a corporate earnings test in coming weeks as investors navigate one of the most volatile periods of the year for equity markets.】

item.title: 波音公司西北太平洋地区数千人周五开始休假
item.description: 波音公司表示，在上周超过 32,000 名工人举行罢工，导致该公司最畅销的 737 MAX 和其他喷气式飞机停产后，周五开始对华盛顿州和俄勒冈州的数千名员工进行休假。【原文：Boeing said furloughs began on Friday for thousands of employees in Washington State and Oregon, after more than 32,000 workers went on strike last week, halting production of the U.S. planemaker's best-selling 737 MAX and other jets.】

item.title: 上诉法院重启对美国药品价格谈判计划的质疑
item.description: 周五，美国一家上诉法院恢复了医疗保健和制药行业团体的一项诉讼，该诉讼对美国有史以来第一部要求制药公司与政府的医疗保险计划（Medicare）进行药品价格谈判的法律提出了质疑。【原文：A U.S. appeals court revived a lawsuit on Friday by healthcare and drug industry groups challenging the first-ever U.S. law requiring pharmaceutical companies to negotiate drug prices with the government's Medicare health insurance program that covers 66 million people.】

item.title: 美国邮政自 2022 年以来首次不再上调邮票价格
item.description: 美国邮政服务公司周五表示，自 2022 年 1 月以来首次不再上调邮票价格，这是继近年来连续涨价之后的又一次涨价。【原文：The U.S. Postal Service said on Friday it will not hike stamp prices in January for the first time since January 2022 after a series of price hikes in recent years.】

item.title: 美国证券交易委员会裁定福克斯公司可跳过对电视舆论节目贴标签的表决
item.description: 美国最高证券监管机构表示，媒体公司福克斯可以避免就一项要求其考虑为新闻和舆论节目贴上不同标签的措施进行股东投票。【原文：Media company Fox can avoid a shareholder vote on a measure asking it to consider different labels for its news and opinion shows, the top U.S. securities regulator said.】

item.title: 黄金突破 2,600 美元大关，美联储减息押注延长历史性上涨行情
item.description: 黄金周五首次飙升至 2,600 美元上方，延续了受美国进一步降息押注和中东紧张局势加剧提振的涨势。【原文：Gold soared above the $2,600 level on Friday for the first time, extending a rally boosted by bets for further U.S. interest rate cuts, and rising tensions in the Middle East.】

item.title: 美国核监管机构尚未收到三哩岛重启申请
item.description: 美国核管理委员会（NRC）周五表示，尚未收到星座能源公司（Constellation Energy）关于重启三里岛核反应堆的申请。【原文：The U.S. Nuclear Regulatory Commission (NRC) said on Friday it has not yet gotten an application from Constellation Energy on restarting the Three Mile Island nuclear reactor.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，金融软件制造商Enfusion正在探索包括出售在内的各种方案
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，美国资产管理软件供应商 Enfusion 正在与投资银行家进行谈判，以评估可能的出售方案。【原文：Enfusion , a U.S. software provider for asset managers, is in talks with investment bankers to evaluate options that could include a potential sale, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 据英国《金融时报》报道，默多克支持的 REA 将收购英国 Rightmove 的报价提高到近 79 亿美元
item.description: 据英国《金融时报》周五报道，由鲁伯特-默多克（Rupert Murdoch）的新闻集团控股的 REA 集团已将其对英国房地产门户网站 Rightmove 的收购要约提高到约 59 亿英镑（78.6 亿美元）。【原文：REA Group , majority-owned by Rupert Murdoch's News Corp , has sweetened its takeover offer for Britain's real estate portal Rightmove to about 5.9 billion pounds ($7.86 billion), the Financial Times reported on Friday.】

item.title: 在美国钢铁工人联合会会议上，成员和领导者淡化了选举分歧
item.description: 在本周举行的钢铁工人联合会（United Steelworkers）工会官员会议上，总统政治被排除在议程之外，这与以往大选年的聚会有所不同，也表明了美国工人联合会成员与工会老板在候选人问题上的分歧。【原文：At a meeting of United Steelworkers union officials this week, presidential politics was off the agenda, a departure from past election-year gatherings and a sign of the division between USW members and union bosses over the candidates.】

item.title: 解说员：美国药房福利管理公司为何受到抨击？
item.description: 美国联邦贸易委员会周五表示，它正在起诉美国三大药房福利管理公司，指控它们滥用权力，操纵药品供应链，人为抬高胰岛素的成本。【原文：The U.S. Federal Trade Commission said on Friday it was suing the country's three largest pharmacy benefit managers, accusing them of abusing their power and rigging the pharmaceutical supply chain to artificially inflate the cost of insulin.】

item.title: 美联储鲍曼表示，基于高于目标的通胀数据，对大幅降息持有异议
item.description: 美联储理事米歇尔-鲍曼（Michelle Bowman）周五表示，她不同意美国央行本周降息半个百分点，而是赞成降息四分之一个百分点，因为通胀率仍高于2%的目标，她担心公众会将更大的举措误解为 "过早地宣布胜利"。【原文：Federal Reserve Governor Michelle Bowman said on Friday she dissented over the U.S. central bank's half-percentage-point interest rate cut this week, favoring a quarter-percentage-point reduction instead, because inflation remains above the 2% target and she worried the public would misinterpret the larger move as "a premature declaration of victory."】

item.title: Stellantis 董事长 Elkann 因涉嫌税务欺诈被扣押 7,500 万欧元
item.description: 意大利都灵检察院周五表示，一名意大利法官因涉嫌税务欺诈调查，扣押了包括 Stellantis 和法拉利主席约翰-埃尔坎在内的五人价值约 7500 万欧元（8400 万美元）的资产。【原文：An Italian judge has seized assets worth around 75 million euros ($84 million) from five people including Stellantis and Ferrari Chair John Elkann over an investigation into alleged tax fraud, the Turin prosecutor's office said on Friday.】

item.title: 美联储主席沃勒尔疲软的通胀数据巩固了降息 50 个基点的理由
item.description: 美国联邦储备委员会（Federal Reserve）理事克里斯托弗-沃勒（Christopher Waller）是该央行为抑制通胀而加息的斗争中较为激烈的声音之一，他说他支持本周进行更大幅度的降息，因为他现在担心物价上涨的速度会低于美联储的目标。【原文：U.S. Federal Reserve Governor Christopher Waller, one of the more ardent voices in the central bank's battle to hike interest rates to tame inflation, said he supported a larger rate cut this week because he is now worried the pace of price increases is undershooting the Fed's target.】

item.title: 美国 FDA 批准阿斯利康的流感疫苗用于自我注射
item.description: 美国食品和药物管理局周五表示，已批准阿斯利康公司的流感鼻腔喷雾疫苗用于自我注射，使其成为首款可供患者自我注射的疫苗。【原文：The U.S. Food and Drug Administration said on Friday it has approved AstraZeneca's influenza nasal spray vaccine for self-administration, making it the first of its kind that patients can give themselves.】

item.title: 美国联邦贸易委员会就胰岛素价格过高起诉药品 "看门人
item.description: 美国联邦贸易委员会周五起诉了美国三大药房福利管理公司，指控它们引导糖尿病患者使用价格更高的胰岛素，以便从制药公司获得数百万美元的回扣。【原文：The U.S. Federal Trade Commission sued the country's three largest pharmacy benefit managers on Friday, accusing them of steering diabetes patients towards higher priced insulin in order to reap millions of dollars in rebates from pharmaceutical companies.】

item.title: 肯尼亚法院认定可就主持人裁员起诉 Meta 公司
item.description: 肯尼亚一家法院周五裁定，Facebook 母公司 Meta 可在这个东非国家因承包商解雇数十名内容审核员而被起诉。【原文：A Kenyan court ruled on Friday that Facebook's parent company Meta could be sued in the East African nation over the dismissal of dozens of content moderators by a contractor.】

item.title: 美国众议院以微弱票数通过废除拜登政府的环保局尾气排放规定
item.description: 美国众议院周五以微弱优势投票通过废除 3 月份通过的清洁汽车规则，该规则规定到 2032 年将整个车队的尾气排放量在 2026 年的基础上减少 50%。【原文：The U.S. House of Representatives on Friday voted narrowly to repeal clean vehicle rules adopted in March to cut fleetwide tailpipe emissions by 50% over 2026 levels by 2032.】

item.title: 航空公司称首架空中客车 A321XLR 将于 10 月下半月交付
item.description: 空中客车公司最远程窄体喷气机 A321XLR 的首次交付将推迟到 10 月份，这显然与该飞机制造商的交付目标相差数周。【原文：The first delivery of Airbus' longest-range narrowbody jet, the A321XLR, is poised to slip into October, apparently missing the planemaker's delivery target by several weeks.】

item.title: 美国航空公司寻求推迟恢复每天两班的中国航班
item.description: 美国航空公司周五要求美国交通部允许其推迟恢复每天两班从美国飞往中国的航班，理由是世界上最大的两个经济体之间的旅行需求滞后。【原文：American Airlines on Friday asked the U.S. Transportation Department to allow it to delay resuming two daily flights to China from the United States, citing lagging travel demand between the world's two largest economies.】

item.title: 美国食品和药物管理局批准泽弗拉公司治疗罕见遗传病的方案
item.description: 美国食品和药物管理局周五表示，美国食品和药物管理局批准了 Zevra Therapeutics 公司治疗一种罕见致命遗传性疾病的药物，使其成为首个获得批准的治疗该疾病的药物。【原文：The U.S. Food and Drug Administration approved Zevra Therapeutics' drug for a rare and fatal genetic disorder, making it the first treatment to get a nod for the condition, the health regulator said on Friday.】
